JobFullDesc: Description - External Are you ready to enhance your skills and build your career in a rapidly evolving business climate? Are you looking for a career where professional development is embedded in its core culture? If so, Deloitte could be the place for you! Join our team of Government & Public Services Financial specialists who support large scale financial transformations by leveraging cutting edge technology and take your career to the next level!  Work You'll Do As a Consultant within our Finance & Enterprise Performance team you will:  Provide general finance and budget management support  Support the collection, analysis, and reporting of project financial data across the entire DCSA Agency  Manage and work with large data sets  Complete data entry, analysis, and forecasting  Take a Portfolio view of all spend plans collected  Understand the different funds and work with customers from different portfolio  Aggregate and understand budget and investment data from multiple sources  The Team  Transparency, innovation, collaboration, sustainability: these are the hallmark issues shaping government initiatives today. Deloitte's Government & Public Services practice is passionate about making an impact with lasting change. Carrying out missions in the GPS practice requires fresh thinking and a creative approach. We collaborate with teams from across our organization in order to bring the full breadth of Deloitte, its commercial and public sector expertise, to best support our clients. Our aspiration is to be the premier integrated solutions provider in helping to transform the marketplace.  At Deloitte, the Finance & Enterprise Performance offering is a trusted advisor to the CFO and senior Finance executives. We work with CFOs to gather, interpret and deliver the deep insights that shape and influence strategic decision making. Which in turn, helps our clients build innovative financial capabilities and improve mission execution. Join us and play a key role in helping to design our clients' roadmap to the future.  Qualifications   Required:  Bachelor's degree in accounting, business, finance or another business-related field  3+ years of relevant consulting or industry experience in financial analysis, transformation or strategic initiatives  Ability to obtain and maintain the required Security Clearance for this role  Travel up to 25% (While 25% of travel is a requirement of the role, due to COVID-19, non-essential travel has been suspended until further notice)  Preferred:  Prior professional services or federal consulting experience  Cost accounting experience  An understanding of ServiceNow and / or a desire to learn the capabilities / functionality of the tool  Highly analytical mindset; a baseline of knowledge or interest in financial analytics  Understanding of the Federal Budget Management process  Experience with financial reporting
